reviewText:
This is an Edited review, after a patch to the game I have changed it from not recommended" to "recommended" I will leave the old review in the bottom and label it as such.

New Review:
I gave the game a hard time as you can read in the bottom
date: and my language was a little jarring
recommended: but the developers were very professional about it. Commented on the review and made changes to the game (I will not take credit for being the sole driving force behind the changes
hoursPlayed: but as a user who reviewed the game I feel like my comments as well as other user's comments were heard and taken into consideration when patching the game. So props to the Devs
voteText:
I'm sure the community appreciates that)

So I will address the negative things that I pointed out originally and how they've changed.
- There is display customization now
- The little cut scenes in every part of the game now can be skipped by pressing "Shift"
- Hard mode does not have an excessive number of save points
helpfulPercent: it is suitably hard.\n- The flashes and things are still there
votesHelpful: but can now be skipped if you so choose.\n- The Soundtrack to the game has been changed

commentsCount: I can focus more on the things that I did like in the game; Like the controls

column21:
and their response to the comments steam users had about the game.

The game now deserves a 7.5/10  and the developer's attitute towards their product and consumers is a 10/10.

reviewText:
So you are ready to enlist in the Yelaxot World. Hmmm?
Well,well,well..........here are some repuirements to play:
1. You have to be a complusive game saver.
2. You have to be a awesome jumper.
3. You have to be a creative thinker.
4. You have to be able to deal with going back-and-forth.
5. You have to be a good person because when you will die- AND YOU WILL DIE, you will go to heaven.
If you cannot say YES SIR to any of these requirements get out of my presences.

So anyway..... I have not completed the game but it seems like a really great game.
The Pros:
1. The world can turn night and day(......BY ITS SELF)
2.You will learn the controls quickly
3. You play as a cute character.
4. Mind-blending but easy puzzles; you got to be meticulous
5. The monsters are easy to beat.
6.  The world is so creative.
7.  Ungrading is always awesome.

The Cons
1. The jumping is a bit tricky.
2. The music can be a bit annoying at times.
3. The controls can be awkward at first.
4. It seems like everyone have pets in there house.
5. The people of the Yexalot world obviously have nothing better to do then to stand around.
6. The loading screens are a bit annoying/


This is pretty much the end of my review.
Why don't you give it a try?
It won't hurt unless you die. :D

reviewText: This game is one of the most fun I've ever played. It exemplifies the open world puzzle-platformer style game and integrates in a very cheerful graphics style. The core of the gameplay is exploring around the world and collecting items whether to open doors, complete quests, or return the stability of the world. Many of the items require puzzles to be solved, some of which are manuvering a block to the exit of a little maze, some of which involved the physical objects in the rooms, and others that require decyphering of clues left around. There is a lot of platforming (as should be expected in a platformer), some of which takes a good many tries. The game reminded me of Fez (another game I loved) but with puzzles that were actually possible to solve without guides. Another benefit of the the game is that the dev is extremely friendly and responds quickly, fixing issues and making changes to the game.\n\nThere were a few minor things that took away from the experience though. I had some issues starting up the game, and with the game slowing under certain circumtances (these issues were quickly addressed by the dev). Occasionally I would jump near the edge of a block and it wouldn't render the jump, so the controls weren't entirely tight. However, if you enjoy the puzzle-platforming genre do yourself a favor and pick this one up. You'll enjoy it.

reviewText:
Yelaxot is a solid Fezlike. Exploration + platforming + puzzle-solving + metroidvania-style backtracking = delight.

Most of the negative reviews are either written about an old version or negative due to technical problems. Download the demo, and if it works for you, you won't to worry about the technical problems.

Thanks to the addition of the new map system, the backtracking is fun instead of frustrating.

Plus, the developer Ryan is friendly and responsive, so contact him if you run into any troubles.
voteText: 9 of 14 people (64%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Made by a single guy, this game is a labor of love for exploration games.

You're free to roam around and slowly unlock new areas mostly in the order you want, and there's little to no pressure on getting things done. Can't find a given item? Just take a stroll in another section of the world, then come back later with a fresh idea, or maybe a new power-up and there you have it. Which isn't to say it's always easy, because the difficulty of the platforming ramps up in the latter sections, as well as in a bonus mini-game.

Not everything is pefect, of course. The common downside of being done all by a single jack-of-all-trades developer is that it's a bit rough around the edges. But the end product is what matters, and it's a very satisfying adventure. All in all, the game is a gem in the rough for fans of exploration-based puzzle platformers.

reviewText:
Yelaxot is game that made me come back and really think about games from the old days like super mario and those types of platform games.
This one is neat and possibly the biggest suprise of all time for me personally.

Lots of interaction and plenty of good things to take notice of.

Its been updated to the max since ive last time reviewed.

Cons: Since last time most of these things i fixed. But some more options like changing volume from music to other sounds is still somtehing i miss. And for fun i wished i could chose between diffrent music tunes i think the new and updated one is good but i loved the older one best.

Get it and give it a chance i like this game!
And in fact i came with suggerstion for improvement for the game.
And it actually was done and implemented :)

reviewText: This game is a charmingly simple puzzle platformer which seems pretty tight.  The dev has done a good job of responding to complaints, but it still has issues.  I run into a lot of tearing, and it doesn't interact well with the XBox 360 controller.\n\nIt's not perfect, but it's definitely worth picking up.  If the technical issues continue to be fixed, I would recommend it whole-heartedly.

reviewText:
If you look at my play time, you'll see it's only 11 minutes or so. However, that's because I played the game a lot more in beta than before it got on Steam. With that cleared up... I'll go with a simple pro/con method.

Pros:
- Very large game, you'll honestly be busy and entertained for hours as there will always be something new to  explore.
- Graphically pleasing. The game looks gorgeous everywhere and you'll see plenty of smaller elements that you don't usually see is games such as small animals in their own environment. These don't affect gameplay, but they're really nice to see once you've noticed them.
- The puzzles are innovative and challenging, which will keep you on your toes if you're into brain-work (I am).
- The game has three levels of difficulty: normal, hard and rage mode. I've played through--not beaten--all of them and they're rather balanced and give you what you'd expect for their difficulty level. On normal hte game isn't too easy or too difficult, just as it should be.

Cons:
- Joy2Key. I'm used to setting up Joy2Key for games that don't support joysticks, however this shouldn't have been packaged with the game if the game doesn't natively support joy functionality. However, this shouldn't be opening on the game's startup.
- Resolutions. My native resolution isn't supported, close but not quite, which isn't entirely an issue since I play in windowed mode.

My overall score is 8/10. I highly recommend this game. If you don't like things like Joy2Key you can always disable it.

reviewText:
Yelaxot is a really unique game compared to all the other crap indie games you have these days.
This game is high quality in terms of graphics, gameplay, and music. Not to mention the controls are very simple and easy to use.
The average playthrough for a new person playing this game is about 15 hours so you'll have plenty to enjoy this game.
If anything, the puzzles are indeed amazing. These puzzles trick your mind, all of them are very good, and some even trick your mind into thinking you don't know the answer, yet it's right in front of you and you don't realize it.

Gameplay: 10/10
Music: 8/10
Graphics: 10/10

Final score; 8.5/10. In terms of comparing Yelaxot however to the majority of other new indies, this excels in being 10/10. I enjoyed this game and if you want to play a REALLY unique Indie game, I recommend Yelaxot. You'll have fun.

Note; Even though it says 0.2 hours have been played I've beaten it before from Desura, so please do not be confused.

Oh by the way, to the people who saying the double jump isn't working, it's the same as in the majority of any other platformers, including Super Mario Bros. If you fall off a ledge then you only have 1 jump. If you jump off the ledge then jump again you'll have two. It works the same in the popular game SSBB4, if you go off the ledge then you'll only have one jump.

reviewText: This game has an old school vibe to it and since I've been growing up with platformers I must say that it's really fun. You can waste a lot of time playing it and I can only imagine what the harder parts of the game are like (Hard mode, Rage mode). The graphics are interesting especially in caves and I can only imagine what Barkalar does next. To sum it all up I definetly recommend this game.

reviewText:
It feels like the complete GameMaker exprience compressed into a single game. Which is to say, it's a mashup of small-sprite-based platforming, a large amount of simple variety, simple music, not-great level design, and a significant amount of gameplay-fine but visually-jarring collision issues.

Oh, and the good old trademark of having a game take a short while to load/save the game.

Overall, I still recommend it. The game is significantly large, cheap, and it just feels like a genuinely different way to make a game than you normally get. And not in an artsy innovative" way either."

reviewText:
I love indie games.
Especially adventure.
But this game... jeez

First of all: the music
Developer, you just need to start selling soundtrack. People would love it.
Actually, it's annoying looping bunch of sounds.
Second of all: save system
The game freezes when trying to load my save. Cool feature.
Also there is no sound and graphic settings in menu. Except when you start the game, you can change resolution (1280x720 maximum)
Very strange map. Whatever.
Difficult to navigate where to go or what to do.
During the time that I played game, the goal is to find keys and unlock doors?
Well, this game is of no interest to me, and I don't think that someone is interested in it.
I hope that greatly respected developer will make it better.

3/10

I recommend this game for people who doesn't regret spending time on this.
